"Zāogāole! Wǒ zhēn wàngle zěnme shuō yīngyǔle..." You groan to yourself, staring at all of the strange symbols and letters on every storefront. None of it makes sense except for some Chinese characters printed on the mall directory.

She's babbling to you in English, and when it looks like she's asking for your approval you give her the occasional reply in the few English words and phrases you still know.

First you swapped onto Sarah's buxom frame, followed by the petite 26-year old woman who briefly tried to steal your body. Then after you and Sarah foiled a robbery, you swapped onto a mother's age-worn body, followed again by your own body. You could have kept your body and gone home if not for a misplaced sense of integrity, as you tried to fix a headswapped man and Asian woman onto their correct bodies... only to mess up and get both the Asian woman's head and body.

--

Back on stage: “Now we’re going to slow things down a little, with some close-up magic,” says Kimiko. She grabs a stool and carries it over to the edge of the stage. With a single spotlight on her, she does some card magic, rope tricks, and sleight of hand using cups & marbles. You’re sitting next to her assisting her (still with Rachel’s body) and extremely amazed at how well she performs each of these illusions.

Meanwhile, the rest of the stage is blanketed in darkness. David, Josh, Jiro, and Gordon scramble and each push out two vertical boxes that are about 4 1/2’ in height. They are all different in colors: red, orange, yellow, green, blue, purple, pink, white, and black.

--

THE FINAL ACT

After performing the “smaller” teaser tricks, Kimiko calls all of her assistants back to the stage. Shortly all seven of your friends walk to either side of the magician. They all stand there next to you until instructed to each enter a different colored box, including you:

Sarah goes in the red box
David goes in to the orange box
Monica goes into the yellow box
Gordon goes in the green box
Rachel goes into the blue box
Jiro goes in the purple box
Jan goes into the pink box
Josh goes into the white box
And you go into the black box.

All of your heads stick out of the top of the cabinets and there are 4 holes in front where you all stick your hands and feet through where you are wiggle them around to show that they’re real.

Kimiko begins pretending to juggle air in front of her and everyone’s heads begin jumping around from box to box! It’s as if Kimiko is juggling them around! Sometimes the heads land upside down, backwards, or sideways on each other’s box!

After a few minutes, the shifting stops and everyone’s heads end up face-forward on a box. Kimiko snaps her fingers and the cabinets swing open.

The audience howls in laughter & delight as not only were all of the assistants’ heads swapped, but also everyone is dressed in skimpy swimwear! The men wear some Speedo briefs and the women are in tiny bikinis! Each swimsuit corresponds to the color of the box:

Sarah’s head is on Gordon’s Latin body in green Speedos.
David’s head is on Sarah’s body in a red bikini.
Monica’s head is on Jiro’s Asian body in purple Speedos.
Gordon’s head is on Jan’s Japanese body in a pink bikini.
Rachel’s head is on David’s African-American body in orange Speedos.
Jiro’s head is on Monica’s black body in a yellow bikini
Jan’s head is on your body wearing a black pair of Speedos.
Josh’s head is back on Maureen O’Sullivan’s body in a tiny shredded leopard print dress.
Your head still continues to be on Rachel’s Latina body in a blue bikini.

Kimiko pretends to look confused and gives everyone a few minutes to sort themselves out. Then shortly, everyone breaks into a dance number and ends in a final alluring pose regardless of whose body they possessed.

Kim grabs a large black sheet that she materializes out of thin air and covers everyone. When she pulls it away everyone’s back to normal. Pyrotechnics flash around the stage then everyone takes a final stance and the audience’s cheers are deafening. There’s standing ovation and they want to see more!

Kimiko leans in and whispers something to you and kisses you on the cheek. She and Uncle Kenichi wrap themselves with a large black cloth and disappear from the stage with a final puff of smoke.

--

Over a week went by and no one had ever seen Kimiko or Kenichi ever again. Your new group of friends are quite sad that Kimiko went away. Even Cheryl, the cheerleader, came by to visit the theatre, that’s now being condemned, hoping that Kimiko would one day return.

You still retain the ability to headswap and do so on occasion with further misadventures and mishaps, but those are other stories…

You watch as the wrecking ball strikes into the theatre and remember all of the fond memories you’ve had these past weeks. Most importantly was the final words that Kimiko told you before she vanished: “Thanks for making my dream possible…” The kiss she gave you was also memorable as well. In your heart you know that Kimiko will return someday, but until that time comes, you agree that this whole ordeal was, well... quite magical…




THE END

1123223412.content:
So Dr. Edwards has been secretly swapping the heads of humans and dogs for years, with her first victims being her assistants on the job. She created a remote-type device that, using powerful beams of light, affects the tissues in the necks of animals, and thus allows them to be detached. This gave her an idea - why not carry out a secret social experiment involving the replacement of normal humans with dog-headed ones. Of course, the invention of the device was part of the reason she’s doing it - she has been fascinated for years with the mythical creatures called cynocephali, which are humans with dog’s heads. She first tested the process on her husky Gregory, whose head she swapped with that of her husband. She then brought in a few first-stage mouth cancer patients from the hospital where she works as her cover job, offering head transplants. These ‘transplants’ were with a number of stray dogs she found on the street, and the dogs were given the job of helping her with the experiment. "Angie," she texted, "I'm having thoughts about Mark". Seconds passed, tense.

"Fuckkkkkkkk"

"Thanks, Anj", Sarah winked. Then she hang there, thinking about that text. Really, of the whole chat. She thought back to what she said to Mark just an hour or so ago. Thought of how much a cartoon she was being. Thought of the sex she was having.

The simple truth was, Sarah wasn't concerned about what some guy was thinking of her, or muse over which of his heads fell off that day. And then you woke from the silence. "Hey big guy," Sarah said from her chair.

"Come here," you invited. And indeed she did, queer look to her eye.

"Then what am I doing walking to your house, Mark?"

"I like your company! I feel at ease, like I can go all out with somebody. And you always make me feel wanted when you put on these outfits, or smile through my bad jokes." You sincerely try to bring her to your side, but you can see you're losing. "You're one of the few people who get me, Sarah."

"That's the thing," she sighs, "It's all about you. What about me, Mark?"

"Hey! I spent $20 on you on a game of milk cans!"

"I remember that-"

"And those times you couldn't afford dinner!"

"Yes, I remember."

"I do a lot for you, baby! And I've got so much more to give!"

"That's another thing, Mark." She looks down on you, dead in the eyes. "You were my enabler. I could spoil myself through you, and you could buy another night in bed with me. It's not healthy." She turns away, her voice clearly hurting, "All those classes I cheated through, those people I left behind. I thought that way back when, when Danny took me behind the baseball bleachers, that I knew what I wanted." At that instant, all the rumors were proven. You never even touched the topic, to keep her close. But that was beside the point.

"What are you saying," you ask.

"I don't know what I want." She holds your head with both hands and holds you from her waist. You can feel her pelvic muscles behind your head. "When I asked, 'You wanna try again?', what I meant was: do you... wanna start anew? Try and get to know a new me?"

You make a V with one of your hands, then flick your tongue inside it, wagging slow and seductively. Sarah blushes at this, instinctively crossing her legs. You smile at this.

"Mark!," she asserts, shoving you away, then turning her back against you, arms crossed.

You walk home one day and get hit in the head afterwards you discover that you can remove your head and put it on others bodies. As you may have expected, chaos ensues.

MAIN CHARACTERS:
You, Mark, 17, 6'
Sarah, your girlfriend, 17, 5'10
Eddie, your African-American friend, 17, 6'1
Jan, Eddie's Japanese-American girlfriend, 17, 5'
Melissa, your older sister, 23, 5'6

No killing characters off.
